Interface Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NodeHeap

    public interface Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
    Author:
    Edwin Rodríguez, Khamille A. Sarmiento

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Heap.MODE 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(V value)
      Adds a new element into the next available spot in the heap.
      void fromArray(V[] array)
      Takes a generic array and places it into a heap that follows the heap property.
      Heap.MODE getMode()
      Returns the mode of the heap, whether it be MAX or MIN.
      V[] getSortedContents()
      Returns a generic array that contains heap values that follow the heap property.
      V remove()
      Depending on whether MAX or MIN heap, this method will remove an element from the top of the heap.
      void setMode(Heap.MODE mode)
      Sets the mode of the heap, whether it be MAX or MIN.
      V[] toArray()
      Copies the elements from the heap into a generic array.

        Adds a new element into the next available spot in the heap.
        Parameters:

      • toArray

        V[] toArray()
        Copies the elements from the heap into a generic array.
        Returns:
        the heap as an array data type.

      • remove

        V remove()
        Depending on whether MAX or MIN heap, this method will remove an element from the top of the heap.
        Returns:
        the top element of the heap.

      • fromArray

        void fromArray(V[] array)
        Takes a generic array and places it into a heap that follows the heap property.
        Parameters:
        array - with generic heap values.

      • getSortedContents

        V[] getSortedContents()
        Returns a generic array that contains heap values that follow the heap property.
        Returns:
        the array with heap-sorted contents.

      • getMode

        Returns the mode of the heap, whether it be MAX or MIN.
        Returns:
        mode of the heap.
